snippet.title: A year at 1.5 per cent - RBA leaves official interest rates on hold
snippet.content:
Official interest rates steady over August
Latest economic data mixed
Steady outlook remains for rates
Midwinter housing markets revive as taxes change
Official interest rates will remain at the record low level of 1.5 per cent over August for the twelfth consecutive month.
Although latest economic data is clearly mixed, is set to maintain its conservative approach to official rate settings.
The remained at a four-year low, but rates in Melbourne and Brisbane have risen sharply over the past year.
The was disappointing, increasing by just 0.2 per cent over the quarter and up by 1.9 per cent over the year.
The would also concern the Reserve Bank.
Midwinter housing markets have revived over July, with increased demand from first home buyers in NSW and Victoria a contributing factor following effective from July 1.
Andrew Wilson is Domain Group Chief Economist Twitter@ Join on LinkedIn and Facebook at
Quarterly house price report
